title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.10.4 | 25-05-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhigaura Bhakta Vrinda
segments.summary: The lecture begins with traditional Vaishnava prayers, invoking blessings and paying respects to spiritual predecessors.

segments.key_quote: During the reign of Maharaj Yudhishthira, the cloud showered all the water that people needed and the earth produced all the necessities of man in profusion.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the fourth verse of the tenth chapter of the first canto of Srimad Bhagavatam, describing the prosperous reign of Maharaj Yudhishthira, characterized by abundant rainfall and earth's bounty.

segments.key_quote: The basic principle of economic development is centred on land and cows.
segments.summary: The lecture emphasizes the importance of land and cows for economic development, highlighting the role of regulated rainfall controlled by Indra Deva, a servant of Lord Krishna, when the king and people obey the Lord's laws.

segments.key_quote: Grains and vegetables can sumptuously feed the man and animals.
segments.summary: The speaker elaborates on the benefits of regulated rains combined with astronomical influences, leading to ample production of grains, fruits, valuable stones, and pearls, emphasizing the importance of grains, vegetables, and milk for nourishment.

segments.key_quote: Cows milk nourishes our brain tissues to understand what is what is Vedic knowledge what is spiritual knowledge
segments.summary: The speaker discusses the importance of cow's milk as a miracle food, emphasizing that cows are meant to be protected and that their excess milk nourishes humans, especially the brain tissues, aiding in spiritual understanding.

segments.key_quote: Why do people need cinemas houses of prostitution slaughterhouse etc proper is raising this point
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts a life focused on spiritual goals with the artificial luxuries of modern civilization, such as cinemas, prostitution, and slaughterhouses, which are deemed unnecessary and misdirected.

segments.key_quote: Factories, Prabhupada says is another name for hell.
segments.summary: The lecture attributes scarcity and adversities to sinful activities and a godless civilization, criticizing factories as hellish environments that mass-produce unnecessary things, disrupting harmony with nature.

segments.key_quote: Why should men kill cows for their selfish purposes? This is a major defect of the human nature.
segments.summary: The speaker reiterates the importance of cow protection for a joyful life, condemning the killing of cows for selfish purposes as a major defect of human nature and questioning the modern civilization's view towards a pure, peaceful human life.

segments.key_quote: This is the way to rule the kingdom that nobody should even attempt to harm a cow.
segments.summary: The speaker narrates the story of Maharaj Pariksit punishing a cow killer, emphasizing the king's duty to protect animals and contrasting this with the perceived shortcomings of modern democracy.

segments.key_quote: We don't have to produce anything. We simply should not interfere with Krishna's arrangement.
segments.summary: The lecture explains Krishna as the seed-giving father and material nature as the mother of all living beings, asserting everyone's right to live under their protection and advocating non-interference with Krishna's arrangement for abundance.

segments.key_quote: So, the purpose of this creation is ultimately self-realization by utilizing whatever is provided for naturally without any difficulty simply by following the laws of God simply by following that.
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by emphasizing the purpose of creation as self-realization through following the laws of God, warning against being misled by a misguided civilization that promotes artificial needs and unnecessary labor, and advocating for a return to a perfect, natural way of life.
